title: AI Browsers Are Not Smart Enough Yet To Take Over Internet
description: When OpenAI unveiled an artificial intelligence-based browser in October, Alphabet Inc. investors expressed concern about what it would mean for Google Chrome, the ubiquitous gateway to the internet used by billions globally. And yet, current versions of AI browsers are far from making legacy products like Chrome obsolete: New offerings from companies such as OpenAI and Perplexity AI Inc. present occasional bugs and trip over some seemingly straightforward requests
content:

title: Trump says he will sign executive order this week on AI approval process
description: President Donald Trump said on Monday he would sign an executive order this week related to the artificial intelligence approval process to avoid having different rules in each U.S. state.
content:

title: How Artificial Intelligence Improves Education Sector and Helps You Create AI Free Content
description: Education has changed fast. It’s no longer limited to books, libraries, or long classroom hours. Today, Artificial intelligence sits at the center of modern learning.
